articles.title: Greetings to President of Cote d'Ivoire
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Cote d'Ivoire
Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Friday sent a message of greetings to Laurent Gbagbo, President of Cote d'Ivoire, on the occasion of the 49th anniversary of the independence of his country.
					 Believing that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would further develop, the message wished him and his people successes in their work for the durable peace and development of the country.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Visits to Russian Federation Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Visits to Russian Federation Observed 
Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Alexander Matsegora, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Russian embassy here, gave a reception at the embassy on Aug. 6 on the occasions of the 8th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's historic visit to the Russian Federation and the 7th anniversary of his visit to the Far Eastern region.
					 Present there on invitation were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Pak Kyong Son, vice department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and officials concerned.
					
					 Officials of the Russian embassy were present. 
					
					 Alexander Matsegora said at the reception that talks held during the visits to the Russian Federation and the Far Eastern region by Kim Jong Il, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, and joint documents signed there contributed to the development of the relations between the two countries and peoples.
					
					 He said he would make every effort to boost the traditional Russia-DPRK friendship and cooperation, setting store by the noble intention of Kim Jong Il who has paid deep attention to the development of the bilateral relations.
					
					 He sincerely wished the Korean people greater success in the work to bolster the nation's defence capability and economic potentials under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Yang Hyong Sop said in his speech that Kim Jong Il's visits to the Russian Federation and the Far Eastern region were a striking demonstration of his personality as a great man born of Heaven and his high international prestige.
					
					 Preserving the spirit of the joint documents agreed upon at the top-level talks and boosting the DPRK-Russia relations on the principle of equality and mutual benefits provide a guarantee for achieving the prosperity common to the two peoples and ensuring the regional security, he noted.

articles.title: DPRK Advances into Semi-finals of Asian Women's Football Championship
articles.content:
DPRK Advances into Semi-finals of Asian Women's Football Championship
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- The DPRK team devastated its south Korean rival 3:0 in a group league match of the 2009 Asian Women's U-19 Football Championship held on August 6.
					 As a result, the DPRK eleven girls came first in Group A to have a semi-final match with the Japanese team.

articles.title: Technology for Drying Impregnating Varnish of Electric Motor Developed
articles.content:
Technology for Drying Impregnating Varnish of Electric Motor Developed
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- The Electronic Materials Research Institute of the DPRK has developed a technology for drying impregnating varnish of electric motor by infrared radiator.
					 The development of the technology makes it possible to solve the scientific and technological problems arising in the manufacture and usage of drum infrared radiator for hardening of impregnating varnish of electric motor such as heat radiation material, heat sensor and automatic regulator, and to produce dryers according to the sizes of electric motors.
					
					 As the dryer uses the heating method by radiator instead of the heating method by convection, it does not need drying stove. Its electricity consumption, therefore, is one of tens and drying speed is five times and more compared with those of old ones.
					
					 Having a function of heat sensor and automatic regulation, it does not destroy insulator but increases the insulation resistance 1.4 fold, thus remarkably extending the serviceable life of the motor.
					
					 The technology registered as a state invention has been applied to many units in various sectors of the national economy to pay off.

articles.title: Summer Food and Custom of Korea
articles.content:
Summer Food and Custom of Korea
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Restaurants in the DPRK are serving various kinds of dishes with national flavor to customers in the mid-summer days.
					 From olden times the Korean people have made various kinds of dishes which help overcome heat and strengthen spirits to use them in their dietary life.
					
					 Famous among articles of summer food are cold noodle, green gram jelly and chopped noodles and green gram jelly mixed with soybean or sesame soups.
					
					 It is a time-honored food custom of the nation to take tangogi soup and young chicken broth with insam in the hottest period of summer.
					
					 The pepper-pot chopped beef soup is also one of the summer dishes.
					
					 People in some areas used to eat rice-gruel prepared with red-bean mashed and strained or rice-gruel mixed with fish.
					
					 Slices of raw carp, snakehead, gray mullet, squid, cuttlefish and octopus are nourishing food for summer.
					
					 Eel and rainbow trout roasted with seasonings and those boiled dry are also popular.
					
					 A historical record says that eating dishes made with eel on July 7 (the 11th of the 24 seasonal divisions) is equivalent to taking insam.
					
					 Besides, there are beverages made with melon and water melon and dishes made with green pumpkin, cucumber, unripe pepper, unripe garlic and others.

articles.title: Korean Fan with Long Tradition
articles.content:
Korean Fan with Long Tradition
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- People with colorful fans in their hands are seen here and there in the current hottest days in the country.
					 The Korean fan has been widely known to the world from olden times for its beauty and delicacy.
					
					 Old relics and records indicate that fan was widely disseminated in the periods of Koguryo and Koryo.
					
					 According to the historical book "Samguksagi" (Chronicles of the Three Kingdoms), Kyonhwon, King of the later Paekje presented a peacock-shaped fan to Wanggon, the founder of Koryo.
					
					 Fans are drawn on the mural of a Koguryo tomb in Anak County, South Hwanghae Province, built in the 4th century.
					
					 Fans were varied. Folding fans and fans with handles were popular in the days of Koryo.
					
					 It was told that the founder of Ming Kingdom, China was fond of the Korean fan so much, especially folding fan, that he ordered to make it in his country and named it "Koryo Fan."
					
					 In the years of Ri Dynasty, the fan shapes became diverse. Among them were fans with animal and plant ornaments hanging from pivots and round, hexagon, heptagon, octagon, lotus leaf shaped, lotus flower shaped, axe-shaped and feather-shaped fans.
					
					 Grass-fans were made with shreds of sedge or cattail. Pieces of paper or flimsy silk cloth were attached to fan faces and various patterns or beautiful pictures were drawn on them.
					
					 As the ceremonial fans, ancestors used luxurious pearl fan with silk-cloth-covered gilded bronze ribs and decorated with beads, and round fan of 60-70 centimeters in diameter with nearly one-meter-long handle.
					
					 Today the Korean people are making more beautiful and convenient fans to suit the socialist way of life by carrying forward the fan making technique of the ancestors.

articles.title: Strict Observance of Principle of Equality among States Called for
articles.content:
Strict Observance of Principle of Equality among States Called for
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Relations between states should be equal and the principle of reciprocity be observed under any circumstances.
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday holds this in a signed article. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The principle of equality is a fundamental rule of action to be observed in the relations between countries and one of the universally accepted guidelines for external activities.
					
					 Failure to observe the principle of equality would lead to the violation of the sovereignty of countries in the international arena and the appearance of the ties of domination and subjugation, the unequal relations among countries and allow some countries to conduct high-handed and arbitrary acts, hurdles in the way of ensuring democracy in the international community. 
					
					 Now that some countries seek to preserve and strengthen the unequal old international order on the basis of their superior military and economic potentials it stands out as a more urgent issue to observe the principle of equality.
					
					 If the principle of equality based on independence is not observed in the international relations, progressive humankind cannot free itself from the imperialists' yoke of domination and subjugation. 
					
					 Only when all the countries and nations firmly maintain the principle of equality in the international relations, is it possible to form and develop the relations of cooperation, reciprocity and non-interference in each other's internal affairs among countries and nations. This will help the countries and nations fully guarantee and consolidate their sovereignty and build new world, independent, peaceful and friendly.
					
					 The DPRK has stood for the development of the international relations based on the principle of equal sovereignty and made positive efforts to ensure it, the article notes, declaring it will firmly maintain the principle of equality in the relations between states and wage a positive struggle for the development of the fair international relations in the future, too.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's Suppression of Jongyojo Assailed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's Suppression of Jongyojo Assailed
Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- The Teachers' Union of south Korea (Jongyojo) made public a statement on August 4 in denunciation of the Lee Myung Bak group's reckless suppression.
					 The statement charged that the Ministry of Administrative Security on the same day reported to the prosecution public servants including members of the Government Employees' Union for Democracy who conducted information activities asserting the validity of the Jongyojo's movement for issuing declarations on the situation and disclosing the injustice of disciplinary measures against teachers and threatened to punish them.
					
					 This is little different from the desperate moves of the Ministry of Education, Science and Technology hell-bent on the suppression of Jongyojo, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that another "massacre of public servants" will be committed in south Korea. This saliently revealed what the "democratization" touted by the Lee Myung Bak dictatorial forces is.
					
					 The Ministry of Administrative Security is busy indiscriminately cracking down upon those incurring its displeasure, talking about "illegal group actions" and "disturbance of order and libel" and the like. This is little short of a revelation of its intention to tame public servants as "sentries and trumpeters serving the Lee Myung Bak regime". 
					
					 The statement declared the organization would resolutely fight against the authorities' unjust suppression of public servants.

articles.title: Lee Group's Fascist Suppression of Workers Flailed
articles.content:
Lee Group's Fascist Suppression of Workers Flailed
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- The Action Headquarters of the Youth and Students Solidarity for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration and Urging the Lee Myung Bak "Government" to Step Down in south Korea issued a statement on August 4 denouncing the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors for its fascist suppression of workers. 
					 Due to the Lee group's repressive action the areas of a factory of Ssangyong Motor Co. looked like a battlefield, the statement noted, adding:
					
					 The authorities fired tear gas and used electric guns and other lethal weapons against the workers demanding the right to existence and hurled even police "commandoes" into the venue of their strike. This barbarous suppression lashed people from all walks of life into great fury.
					
					 It declared that youth and students would join the people of various social standings including the unionists of Ssangyong Motor Co. in their action.

articles.title: Actions against "Projects to Improve Four Large Rivers" Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Actions against "Projects to Improve Four Large Rivers" Called for in S. Korea
Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- The "All-people Measure Committee for Checking the Project Aimed at Destroying Four Life-Giving Large Rivers and Protecting Them" made up of more than 450 civic and public organizations, four religious orders and opposition parties of south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on August 4. It called for actions against the so-called "project to improve four large rivers" pushed forward by the conservative ruling forces.
					 The organization recalled that the above-said project unilaterally pushed forward by the "government" is sparking off protest among all the people.
					
					 It accused the authorities of pushing ahead with the project at high speed by spending a huge sum of money, ignoring the will of people.
					
					 The organization said that a people's fact-finding group was formed as a counter-measure, declaring the group would prove the injustice of the project through a fact-finding survey.

articles.title: Solidarity with Korean Youth and Students Called for
articles.content:
Solidarity with Korean Youth and Students Called for
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- An international seminar of youth and students of the world on the theme of "We will defeat imperialism" sponsored by the World Federation of Democratic Youth took place in Cuba from July 28 to 30. 
					 The seminar attended by delegates of more than 30 organizations of different countries expressed full support to the Korean youth and students in their just cause. 
					
					 The president of the federation called for strengthening the solidarity with the Korean youth and students in the run-up to 2010 which will mark the lapse of six decades since the U.S. imperialists ignited the Korean War.
					
					 The vice-president of the federation strongly denounced the United States for setting up lots of military bases in Japan and south Korea and other areas of the Asia-Pacific region, bringing huge forces and a large number of nuclear weapons to south Korea and areas around it and staging joint military exercises targeted against the DPRK every year, seriously threatening the regional peace and security.
					
					 In order to put an end to these acts the youth and students of the world should unite close with each other and resolutely struggle against the U.S. imperialists, he declared.

articles.title: Day of Victory in Fatherland Liberation War Observed
articles.content:
Day of Victory in Fatherland Liberation War Observed
Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Seminars were held in Pakistan and Colombia on July 25 and 26 on the occasion of the 56th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					  Ferojudin, advisor for the chief minister of the Sind State Government of Pakistan, said that the Korean people's victory in the war was entirely attributable to the distinguished leadership art and great Juche-based tactics of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Akrak Aktar Hamidi, chairman of the Pakistan Association for Self-Reliance Studies, said that the Korean people's victory in the war marked the beginning of the decline of the U.S. imperialists, thus inspiring the progressive people in their struggle to build an independent new world.
					
					 Jairo Gonzalez Trujillo, president of the "Kanggye" Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of Colombia, recalled that Kim Il Sung brought about the victory in the war thanks to the political and ideological advantages of the Korean People's Army and people based on his original military idea.
					
					 Meanwhile, photo exhibitions and film shows were held in Laos and Guinea and film shows in Uganda, Malaysia, Indonesia, Russia and Ethiopia between July 21 and 26 on the same occasion.
					
					Displayed in the venues of the photo exhibitions were photos on successes achieved by the army and people of the DPRK in the struggle to build socialism and achieve national reunification under the Songun revolutionary leadership of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Participations of the film shows watched Korean films including "Reply of Korea" and "Arms of Korea."

articles.title: Cause of National Reunification Supported
articles.content:
Cause of National Reunification Supported
Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Songchit Pullarp, chairman of the Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea of Thailand, issued a statement on July 31 on the occasion of the 12th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification".
					 The statement noted that President Kim Il Sung laid down the most fair and aboveboard and reasonable proposal for national reunification on the basis of a profound insight into the situation on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 Kim Jong Il formulated the three principles of national reunification, the ten-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo advanced by President Kim Il Sung as the three charters for Korea's reunification, it said, and continued:
					
					 The north-south joint declaration adopted and published on June 15, 2000 is a cornerstone for developing the inter-Korean relations as it clarifies the fundamental principles and ways for achieving national reconciliation, unity and reunification and a great programme for Korea's reunification.
					
					 Noting that the north-south declarations indicate fair and reasonable orientation and ways for achieving Korea's reunification independently and peacefully, the statement expressed belief that the Korean people would certainly achieve the historic cause of national reunification under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Equipo coreano de futbol femenino avanza a la semifinal
articles.content:
Equipo coreano de futbol femenino avanza a la semifinal
Pyongyang, 7 de agosto (ATCC) -- El equipo coreano gano por 3 a 0 a la seleccion surcoreana en el partido que tuvo lugar el dia 6 como parte de las clasificatorias por grupos del Campeonato Asiatico de Futbol Femenino Sub-19 de 2009. 
					Por consiguiente, el once coreano ocupo el primer lugar en su grupo A y jugara en la semifinal frente a Japon.

articles.title: Desarrollada tecnologia para secar barniz impregnado en el motor
articles.content:
Desarrollada tecnologia para secar barniz impregnado en el motor
Pyongyang, 7 de agosto (ATCC) -- Recientemente, el Instituto de Materiales Electronicos de Corea desarrollo la tecnologia para secar el barniz impregnado en el motor electrico con el radiador de rayos infrarrojos.
					  Esta tecnologia posibilito resolver los problemas cientifico-tecnicos, que se presentan en la fabricacion y el uso de la secadora del barniz impregnado en el motor cilindrico, como el material de radiacion termica, el aparato sensor y regulador automatico de la temperatura, etc.
					
					Como resultado, fueron fabricadas las secadoras adecuadas a los tamanos de motores electricos de varios tipos.
					
					  Estas secadoras emplean el metodo de calentamiento a traves de la radiacion en lugar del anterior de conveccion.
					
					  Por eso, pueden prescindir del horno secador y por consiguiente, terminar el proceso de secado mas de 5 veces mas rapido que antes consumiendo una decenas de partes de energia.
					
					  Gracias a la funcion del sensor de temperatura, previenen totalmente la ruptura de las partes barnizadas e incrementan mas de 1.4 veces la resistencia de esta sustancia aislante, lo cual permite alargar mucho la duracion del motor electrico.
					
					  Esta tecnologia registrada como invencion estatal comenzo a aportar beneficios en muchas unidades de varios sectores de la economia nacional.

articles.title: Abanicos de Corea de larga historia
articles.content:
Abanicos de Corea de larga historia
Pyongyang, 7 de agosto (ATCC) -- En Corea, que esta ahora en plena estacion canicular, pueden ver facilmente a los hombres que andan con los abanicos de diferentes formas y colores.
					  Este medio resfriador hecho en Corea es ampliamente conocido en el mundo desde la antiguedad por su elegancia y fineza.
					
					  Segun los vestigios y registros historicos, en Corea el abanico se expandio ampliamente en los periodos de Coguryo y Coryo.
					
					  El libro de historia "Samguksagi" anota que el rey de Paekje Posterior, Kyonhwon habia enviado "Kongjakson" (abanico en forma de pavo real) al rey fundador de Coryo, Wanggon.
					
					El abanico aparece dibujado tambien en la tumba  con la pintura al fresco de la epoca de Coguryo,  construida en el siglo IV en el distrito de An-ak de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur.
					
					Entre varios tipos eran famosos en el periodo de Coryo el abanico plegable y el de empunadura.
					
					El rey fundador del Reino de Ming, de China, quien preferia el abanico coreano, mas todavia el plegable, ordeno producirlo en su pais y llamarlo como "Coryoson" (abanico de Coryo).
					
					En la epoca de la Dinastia de los Ri, se desarrollaron los metodos de confeccion como el de colgar en el roblon de abanico los adornos en forma de animales y plantas.
					
					Se diversificaron tambien sus formas, por ejemplo, la redonda, la hexagonal, la heptagonal, la octagonal y las parecidas a la hoja y la flor de loto, el hacha, la pluma, etc.
					
					En la fabricacion del abanico de paja se usaban Cyperus exaltatus o la espadana. 
					
					En la cara de este articulo se pegaban el papel o la seda fina y se dibujaban tambien varias estampas o pinturas hermosas.
					
					Los antepasados usaban en las ceremonias el lujoso abanico de perla, en el homocentro dorado del cual estaba pegada la seda y habia abalorios, y el otro de la empunadura de un metro de largo mas o menos acoplada con la parte principal redonda de entre 60 y 70 centimetros de diametro.
					
					Hoy en dia, el pueblo coreano usa los abanicos mas elegantes y comodos hechos conforme al modo de vida socialista heredando y desarrollando la tecnologia de los antepasados.

articles.title: Hay que mantener principio de igualdad, insiste Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Hay que mantener principio de igualdad, insiste Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, 7 de agosto (ATCC) -- Las relaciones entre los Estados deben ser iguales, ocurra lo que ocurra, y establecidas en el principio de reciprocidad.
					Senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual fechado 7 y continua:
					
					El principio del particular es la regla principal de actividades a ser mantenida sin falta en las relaciones mutuas entre los paises y una de las guias generales de las actividades exteriores.
					
					Cuando no se mantiene este principio de igualdad,  se vera violada la soberania de los paises en la escena internacional y se crearan las relaciones de dominacion y subyugacion, o sea, las de desigualdad entre los paises. Tambien se permitiran el despotismo y la arbitrariedad de algunos paises, lo cual obstaculizara la democratizacion de la sociedad internacional.
					
					Hoy dia, algunos paises pretenden mantener el desigual y caduco orden internacional apoyandose en sus superiores potencias militares y economicas. Por lo tanto, se presenta mas apremiante el problema de mantener el principio de igualdad.
					
					Al no materializar el principio en cuestion basado en la independencia en las relaciones internacionales, la humanidad progresista no puede liberarse del lazo de la dominacion y la subyugacion de los imperialistas.
					
					Si todos los paises y naciones mantienen este principio en las relaciones internacionales, sera posible establecer y desarrollar las relaciones de cooperacion, beneficio mutuo y la no intervencion en los asuntos internos entre aquellos. Con ello, se garantizara con firmeza y se consolidara la soberania de los paises y las naciones, y a la larga, se construira un nuevo mundo independiente, pacifico y amistoso.
					
					La Republica Popular Democratica de Corea ha venido abogando por el desarrollo de las relaciones internacionales basadas en el principio de igualdad  de la independencia y esforzandose activamente por su realizacion. Tambien en el futuro luchara dinamicamente por mantener susodicho principio en las relaciones entre los Estados y por el desarrollo de las imparciales relaciones internacionales.
